Accountant Job at Grand Towers Limited




        
    

        
        Grand Towers Limited is a dynamic and forward-thinking private equity firm that prides itself on identifying and investing in high-potential opportunities across a diverse range of industries. With a keen eye for emerging trends and a commitment to strategic partnerships, Grand towers has built a robust and dynamic investment portfolio, spanning fintech, hospitality, real estate, communication, and financial information sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location: Anambra
Job Type: Full-time

Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Accountant/Financial Controller to join our dynamic team.
	If you have a background in the hospitality sector and a passion for financial management, we’d love to hear from you!


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee and manage the financial operations of the hotel, ensuring accuracy in reporting and compliance with financial regulations.
	Prepare financial statements, balance sheets, and profit & loss reports.
	Manage budgeting, forecasting, and cost control processes.
	Coordinate audits and maintain internal financial controls.
	Work closely with management to provide insights and support decision-making.


Requirements


	3 to 4 years of experience in the hospitality sector as an Accountant.
	Experience working in a 5-star hotel will be an added advantage.
	Strong knowledge of financial management software and tools.
	Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment while maintaining attention to detail.


Salary
N120,000 monthly.

Note: If you meet the criteria and are excited to join a leading hospitality team, apply now.

  "description": "Eta Zuma Mining and Industries Limited provides premium solutions to businesses in the primary and secondary sectors of the economy, especially those in solid minerals, extractive industry, manufacturing industry and agriculture. Some of its clients are Zuma 828 Coal Limited, IMEX Mineral Resources and Processing Company, Zuma Energy Nigeria Limited, Zuma Steel W/A Limited, and Zuma Metals &amp; Energy Resources Limited.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Admin Officer / SSO

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary


	The Department Admin / SSO is responsible for providing administrative and secretariat support to the Head of Department and unit heads, ensuring effective coordination, documentation, and alignment with the company&rsquo;s Document Management System with oversight support from ECSEC Admin.


Responsibilities
The role covers the following key areas:
Meeting Coordination &amp; Support:


	Organize and support departmental meetings, including preparing agendas, ensuring continuity of pending items, and following up on action points.
	Provide full secretariat support during meetings by recording minutes, documenting resolutions, and tracking assigned tasks through to closure.


Documentation &amp; Reporting:


	Maintain accurate records by uploading signed-off minutes, resolutions, and departmental documents to SharePoint in line with company standards.
	Support the HOD in preparing departmental reports (monthly, quarterly, annual) and provide regular updates to the Executive Chairman&rsquo;s Secretariat on administrative performance.


Document Management &amp; Control:


	Serve as custodian of departmental records, ensuring proper registration, filing, processing, archiving, and retrieval of documents.
	Work with the Document Management Unit of ECSEC to ensure compliance with company-wide document control processes.


Correspondence &amp; Communication:


	Manage departmental communications by extracting key directives from official channels and archiving correspondence on SharePoint.
	Ensure Chairman- and department-related communications are properly documented and accessible.


General Administrative Support:


	Provide logistics, tools, and materials required for departmental operations.
	Liaise with other departments and process owners as authorized by the HOD to support smooth interdepartmental collaboration.
	Perform other administrative duties as assigned within the scope of engagement.


Qualifications / Requirements


	Education: Bachelor&#39;s degree in Business Administration, Social Sciences, or related field.
	Years of Experience: Minimum of 1-3 years of Administrative experience.
	Technical Skills: Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint); experience with SAP or other ERP systems is an advantage.
	Strong written and verbal skills; professional phone and email etiquette.
	Ability to manage schedules, documents, and multitask efficiently.
	Accurate data entry, filing, and document retrieval&mdash;both physical and digital.
	Understanding of company policies, confidentiality, and support for audits.
	Detail-oriented, reliable, and able to work well with teams across departments.


Salary

Admin Officer / SSO Job at Eta Zuma Mining and Industries Limited




        
    

        
        Eta Zuma Mining and Industries Limited provides premium solutions to businesses in the primary and secondary sectors of the economy, especially those in solid minerals, extractive industry, manufacturing industry and agriculture. Some of its clients are Zuma 828 Coal Limited, IMEX Mineral Resources and Processing Company, Zuma Energy Nigeria Limited, Zuma Steel W/A Limited, and Zuma Metals & Energy Resources Limited.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Admin Officer / SSO

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary
     

            
    




	The Department Admin / SSO is responsible for providing administrative and secretariat support to the Head of Department and unit heads, ensuring effective coordination, documentation, and alignment with the company’s Document Management System with oversight support from ECSEC Admin.


Responsibilities
The role covers the following key areas:
Meeting Coordination & Support:


	Organize and support departmental meetings, including preparing agendas, ensuring continuity of pending items, and following up on action points.
	Provide full secretariat support during meetings by recording minutes, documenting resolutions, and tracking assigned tasks through to closure.


Documentation & Reporting:


	Maintain accurate records by uploading signed-off minutes, resolutions, and departmental documents to SharePoint in line with company standards.
	Support the HOD in preparing departmental reports (monthly, quarterly, annual) and provide regular updates to the Executive Chairman’s Secretariat on administrative performance.


Document Management & Control:


	Serve as custodian of departmental records, ensuring proper registration, filing, processing, archiving, and retrieval of documents.
	Work with the Document Management Unit of ECSEC to ensure compliance with company-wide document control processes.


Correspondence & Communication:


	Manage departmental communications by extracting key directives from official channels and archiving correspondence on SharePoint.
	Ensure Chairman- and department-related communications are properly documented and accessible.


General Administrative Support:


	Provide logistics, tools, and materials required for departmental operations.
	Liaise with other departments and process owners as authorized by the HOD to support smooth interdepartmental collaboration.
	Perform other administrative duties as assigned within the scope of engagement.


Qualifications / Requirements


	Education: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Social Sciences, or related field.
	Years of Experience: Minimum of 1-3 years of Administrative experience.
	Technical Skills: Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint); experience with SAP or other ERP systems is an advantage.
	Strong written and verbal skills; professional phone and email etiquette.
	Ability to manage schedules, documents, and multitask efficiently.
	Accurate data entry, filing, and document retrieval—both physical and digital.
	Understanding of company policies, confidentiality, and support for audits.
	Detail-oriented, reliable, and able to work well with teams across departments.


Salary
N150,000 monthly.
